availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: George P. Huddleston (Pendleton County, Kentucky, farm worker and soldier.)

body.p: Pendleton County, Kentucky, farm worker and soldier. Campbell County, Kentucky, native. Son of Charles Huddleston. Married to Malinda Pribble Huddleston in Pendleton County on November 10, 1864. Father of Lyda B. Huddleston. Resident of Campbell County in 1850. Farm laborer in Pendleton County in 1860. Served in the Eighteenth Kentucky Volunteer Infantry (U.S.A.) as a private from February 8, 1862, to October 30, 1862. Wounded and captured at the Battle of Richmond, Kentucky, on August 30, 1862. Discharged due to medical disability on October 30, 1862.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Campbell County, District No. 2, p. 121A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pendleton County, p. 624.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pendleton County, Precinct No. 4, p. 455B.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0313.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Pendleton County, KY, June and July 1863, p. 215.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Pendleton County Marriages, Film #000272801.
